    void
    showLevel3Result​(int winner)
    This method shows the result of Level 3 to Player if Player wins, there will be green background if Player loses, there will be red background Since we didn't implement Level 4 There will be same Back to Dashboard button for going Dashboard for both cases

      private void opponentPlaysNormal​(Card c)
      This method handles the cases if opponent decided to play normal without bluffing
      Parameters:
      c - Opponent's card, which is selected by opponent

    • opponentWinnerCase

      private void opponentWinnerCase()
      This method resets pile and make appropriate variables 0 in case of turn winning of opponent

    • opponentBluffingChoice

      private void opponentBluffingChoice()
      This method decides opponent will bluff or not in case of there's only one card in pile There's %30 probability computer will bluff

      This method decides match will continue or end

    • showBluffButtonsPlayer

      public void showBluffButtonsPlayer​(javafx.scene.Node c)
      This method handles showing bluffing buttons for player and assigning event handlers to these buttons
      Parameters:
      c - Player's Card, which will be pressed on Screen

    • showBluffOrNotButtons

      public void showBluffOrNotButtons​(Card c)
      This method handles showing buttons for selecting opponent is bluffing or not Trust button stands for opponent is not bluffing Challenge button stands for make opponent exposes bluffing card
      Parameters:
      c - Card which is selected by opponent to be bluffed

    • showBluffingButtons

      private javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle showBluffingButtons()
      This method deactivate player's cards with putting rectangle on them
      Returns:
      Rectangle instance, which is used for deactivating

    • showLevel3Result

      public void showLevel3Result​(int winner)
      This method shows the result of Level 3 to Player if Player wins, there will be green background if Player loses, there will be red background Since we didn't implement Level 4 There will be same Back to Dashboard button for going Dashboard for both cases
      Parameters:
      winner - This argument is for specifying winner as 0 stands for opponent, 1 stands for Player

    • showOpponentBluffingDecision

      public javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle showOpponentBluffingDecision​(javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle rec, javafx.scene.control.Label info, javafx.scene.control.Button cont)
      This method handles showing of opponent's decision about player's bluffing try
      Parameters:
      rec - Rectangle for showing Button cont and Label info
      info - Label for opponent's decision
      cont - Button for continuing playing
      Returns:
      Rectangle instance, which is used for deactivating player's cards

    • opponentThinksBluff

      public void opponentThinksBluff​(javafx.scene.Node c)
      This method executes commands, where opponent thinks player is bluffing
      Parameters:
      c - Card, which is selected by player to be bluffed

    • opponentTrusted

      public void opponentTrusted​(javafx.scene.Node c)
      This method is called, when opponent trusted player' bluff
      Parameters:
      c - Card, which is selected by player to be bluffed
